Dear {!Contact.FirstName} {!Contact.LastName},
Thank you for contacting LegalZoom for your business needs. In regard to your inquiry, LegalZoom can assist you in filing your Utility Patent. We simplify the process for you by preparing and submitting the Utility Patent application to the US Patent & Trademark Office (USPTO) for registration.
For your reference, general information regarding filing a Utility Patent has been outlined below. If you would like to get specific, detailed information on your personal situation, please contact an Intellectual Property Specialist at the phone number listed below. By speaking with a Specialist, we will be able to assist with answering further questions, as well as building a customized package to best benefit your needs.
Utility Patents typically protect original inventions, unique improvements on existing items, or some methods or processes . Utility Patents grant property rights to the inventor, and prevents other parties from using, making, selling, or importing the patented item(s) without your permission, and allows you to enforce against any infringement upon these rights. The term of a Patent is typically 20 years from the date the Patent Application is filed with the USPTO.
The Utility Patent process is a two-step process. Step I consists of a Patent consultation and review with a registered patent attorney or patent agent, technical Patent illustrations creation and/or review, and an optional comprehensive Patent Search. Upon placing the order for your Utility Patent, you will be given instructions describing how to submit supplemental details of your items(s) to LegalZoom, either by directly uploading the file, emailing copies, or submitting hard copies by mail.
For your convenience, we have listed all relevant pricing below.
